page.title: 19Poynton Station continued
page.content: It has an hourly service in both directions during the latter part of the morning, early afternoon and late evening. The frequency of trains increases to half-hourly service during rush hours. The trains are electric running from Manchester (Picadilly) to Stafford - stopping at all stations en route. Twice a day in each direction the Manchester_Birmingham train stops at Poynton. Formerly the station handled coal and milk traffic. There were sidings and a signal box both of which have been demolished. A gas works and brick works were located near the station - both served by sidings. All of this industry has now disappeared. Today the station has three regular staff with the official grade of leading railwaymen.
